title: Welcome to the Project Graph
content: This guided tour highlights how the project graph organizes tasks by dependency layers, priority, and estimated work. Follow the steps to learn how to read the visual encodings and use the controls to explore.

title: Project Start
content: The start node anchors Layer 1 tasks — these have no prerequisites and begin the project timeline.

title: What layers mean
content: Tasks are placed in layers computed from dependencies: Layer 1 = no prerequisites, Layer N depends on earlier layers. Use this to identify sequencing and bottlenecks.

title: Inspect a Task
content: Click a task node to open detailed information: description, estimated hours, assigned workers, and explicit dependencies.

title: Priority & Size
content: Color encodes priority (Critical / High / Medium / Low). Node size indicates estimated hours — larger nodes usually mean more work or longer time.

title: Project Milestone (End)
content: Terminal tasks flow into this milestone. Use it to identify final deliverables and completion points.

title: Legend & Controls
content: Open the Legend to see mapping of colors and line types. The menu also provides search, filtering by priority, and tour controls.

title: Try it out
content: Use the search box to find tasks, try filtering by priority, and click nodes to inspect details. When ready, close this tour and explore the graph freely.
